Key:
It's usually so lively, so it feels lonely when it's
just the two of us.
Yeah, especially compared to the party yesterday.

(After eating dinner, we cleaned up and finally settled
in.)

(Today's dinner was just Maria and myself. According
to Maria, Rinne held a cooking class at the Spirit
mansion.)

(I was going to head over there after hearing that,
but all dishes would need Rinne's approval before I
could eat them, so they all put up a good fight.)
Well, I guess you'd be conferred full mastership, huh?

Conferred full mastership? What are you talking about,
Shido?

Well, you're the only one who Rinne approves of in the
cooking realm, right? I mean, you made breakfast with
her in the morning, too.

Do you think so? At the very least, Shido, I thought
you liked Rinne's cooking more.

No, that's not true. Rinne is Rinne. Maria is Maria.
I can't compare you two. You both make really
delicious food.

Although I arrange it a bit differently, my cooking is
all a copy of yours, Shido. So for you to say it's good
gives me mixed feelings.

That's not true, Maria. You put your heart into it
when you cook. If someone likes it, that means you're
a great cook.

Thank you, Shido. Then I will do my best so you can
say once again that it's delicious.
Got it.

(Seeing Maria's pure smile made me feel a little
embarrassed, and I looked away toward the clock.)

It's about the same time as yesterday... Hey, Maria.
Is it okay if I go out on a stroll?

Understood. I'm not going to ask you where you are
going, but... Please be careful.
Got it. Thanks.

(Rio said she'll be at the park. I'm sure no one will
interrupt us this late.)
Hey, Shido?
Whoa... Hey Rinne, welcome back.
Thanks, Shido. Are you heading out?
Uhhh, yeah. I'm going to go walk off my dinner.

Again? You went out last night, too. Are you hiding
something from me?
Oh, it's not like that...

Rinne, it's fine. He's just going out for a stroll.
I guess he ate too much.

I see. That's fine, but... it's cold out, so be sure
to come home soon, okay? You were late last
night...

S-Sorry. I'll try to get home as soon as possible
tonight. See you later.

Okay, later. After I clean up a little, I'm going to
go home. So don't worry Maria-chan too much,
okay?
Got it.
Well, good night.
Yeah, good night.
Hehe... That was a close one.
...Wh-What are you talking about?
Nothing.
(I wonder if Maria knows. That I'm seeing Marina.)

(No... Maybe I'm thinking too much about it. But she
must be thinking I'm hiding something.)

Well, I'll be on my way now. Oh, should I drop by the
convenience store?
...Hmmm. Would you buy me some pudding?
Pudding? Got it. Any kind's okay?
Yes. Be safe. I'll see you later.
Yeah, later... Hm?

(Maria seemed a bit strange... Well, I should hurry up
and go to the park now.)
She should be here, right?

(Rio said the park, but I couldn't tell if it was the
small park nearby or the big one.)

(I went to the small park, but Rio didn't seem to be
there. So I tried coming here, but...)
Wait, is that...?
So you did come, Shido Itsuka.
Hey, Marina. Haven't seen you at all since yesterday.

Gosh, you sure are acting all chummy. I don't really
care to see you.
*Grunt*...
No... She really wanted to see you!
...Excuse me?
Now which one is the truth? Which do you think it is?
How should I know?
What if you actually have a crush on me? Just kidding.

How should I know? That's something only you'd
know, Marina.
Oh. What a noble answer. You're no fun at all.
It's not... about fun or not.
Okay, okay, fine then, justice hero.
Wh-What's your problem...

(Marina seems to be a little different today. I don't
know why, though.)
What if you actually have a crush on me? Just kidding.
Hm? What's the matter, Marina?

I was just thrown off by your joke! Of course that's
not true!

I was only kidding. Anyways, you were the one who
started joking first.

Well... true. But those kinds of jokes annoy me. Of
course there'd be no way... I'm the same as Maria.
Um, well... Sorry.
It's fine. I don't care.

(Marina looked away. She seemed to be a little
different from the Marina I knew.)

(That's right. She's very similar to Maria. I guess
given their relationship, it's natural.)
Oh, Papa!
(Rio popped up from a bench nearby.)
Hey, Rio. I've come to see you.

Hehehe. I'm happy you came to see me, Papa. Will you
help me too?
Help you? What do you need help with, Rio?
Hmm. Well, I'm looking for the most important thing.

The most important thing...? So what happens if you
don't find it?
It'll all be gone.
All... be gone? Wait...

Rio... You still haven't told Shido Itsuka the secret of
this world yet?
The secret of this world?
Yes, the secret. About the incomplete Eden.
Eden...?! So we are inside Eden?!

What do you want to do, Rio? Is it okay to tell
everything to Shido Itsuka?
If Papa will help me, it's fine.
So she says. What do you want to do, Papa?

...I want to help her for now. But depending on what
she says, I may not be able to help.
Ahaha! You're too honest. But I like that about you.

I like the honest part about you too, Papa! So it's
okay. You can tell him, Marina.

Then let's keep it quick. There's a time limit to this
world, the incomplete Eden.

A time limit? Does that mean if we just do nothing,
we can get out of here?

Yeah, to put it simply. You can just run out the
clock. This world is very unstable and dangerous.
Seeing Rio here, I think it'll last another week.

(Oh my God. So then everything will be resolved on
its own. I just need to wait for it to happen and―)

(Suddenly I felt a pang of pain in my heart. Before I
could figure out why, Marina continued on.)

But you see, Rio's different. She thinks that this
world should continue to exist. That's her purpose
and her role.

Rio wants to make everyone very, very happy. Papa,
Mama, Marina, everyone! See, I think we can only be
happy here.

But if we do that... Wouldn't Rinne be in a lot of
pain? Repeating time over and over, all alone? And in
the end, it'll still be the same. Am I wrong?

Shido Itsuka, you sure are level headed. I'm a bit
surprised. That makes me love you more.
You never loved me, though...

Hahaha... Was it that obvious? But you see, it's not
the answer you're thinking of, Shido Itsuka. I mean,
Rinne Sonogami isn't involved with this Eden.
Rinne's not involved?! That can't be...

See, Papa... Rio is the one making this Eden. Rio's
working hard.
You're... supporting this Eden?

(I should have considered that. But when she actually
said it, it seemed so impossible.)

But Rio doesn't have big powers. So... I need to find
the most important thing.

As Rio stated, she can't be the only one maintaining
Eden. She needs another piece to solidify this world.
That's the most important thing.

(A piece to solidify this world... The most important
thing... A piece of the world. Proof that Eden―that
Rinne existed.)
(It's―)

(I thought about the spare key. One you can't say is
in reality or Eden. It's uncertain... but definitely
something important.)

You look like you know what it is. Do you know the
answer?

Well... I can't say for sure. I can't gather my
thoughts.
I see. Then we'll leave it at that.
What do you mean?
Beats me. Why don't you ask yourself?
(...I guess I can't hide it from Marina.)
Hm? Papa, what's the matter?
Nothing. I was just thinking about something.

I see. But you're going to help me look for it, right
Papa?
Uh... Hm...
Shido Itsuka.
Hm?

You'd best think hard, or you might regret it. Maria,
Rio, Rinne Sonogami... and me. If this world
disappears, so will we.
...I know.

(I knew it all too well. That's why I felt the pain in
my heart earlier. The pain of having to lose something
I lost once again.)

(If I let it remain, I guess it'll be resolved. But
will I be okay with that? Is that really the right
decision?)

(The more I thought, the less I knew. I felt myself
wavering on making a decision. My mind was like a
pendulum going back and forth. I couldn't decide.)

(The Ruler―Rinne―said that there was happiness in
this world. And I denied that. The happiness given to
me was nothing to the small happinesses I obtained.)

(But I was able to say that because I didn't know
anything. It's because I didn't think that Rinne would
live here endlessly that I was able to say that.)

(But what about now? The same thing is going to
repeat itself. Can I let that happen?)

(I can, I can't. I can, I can't. I can. I can't. I couldn't
make up my mind, and time continued to pass...)
Papa? Are you okay?
...?! Yeah, I'm fine. I've made my decision for now.

You're always so indecisive, but you came up with an
answer that fast? Are you more clever than I thought?
Or did you think so hard that you went mad?

Why are you saying that?! I haven't gathered my
thoughts yet... but for now I'll help. I want to
continue to be with you both, Rio and Marina.
Hahaha. Papa, I love you! Let's find it together!

It should be so easy for you to just cut us off
because we don't really exist... You're so dumb.
What's the matter, Marina? Your face looks red.
I'm just a bit cold. Don't worry about it, Rio.

(She smiled warmly and patted Rio's head. They looked
like siblings.)
You sure are an awesome big sister.
Big sister? Rio doesn't have a big sister...
Marina is a friend!
Yes. Friends.
I see. Aren't you happy, Marina?

"Don't "Are you happy?" me. That makes no sense.
Shouldn't you go home soon?"

Oh, look at the time. Kotori might be home, too...
I'm sure Maria's waiting.

I'm going to make Rio rest, so hurry up and go home.
She's looking forward to the pudding.

I'll do that. Tomorrow's my day off, so I'll help you in
the morning. Is that okay, Rio?
Okay. Let's do it together, Papa.
Okay.

Then let's meet up at the nearby park. Take care of
Rio, Shido Itsuka.
Okay. I'm going home now. See you both tomorrow.
Okay. Bye-bye, Papa! I can't wait!
Hurry home... Later, Shido.

(I split ways with Marina and Rio. But as I walked
home with the pudding from the store, all I could
think of was the decision I couldn't make.)

(I promised Rio that I'd help her find it. But I know
she won't. No matter how much she goes through the
town looking for traces of Rinne, she won't find it.)
What should I do...

(I muttered the question as I walked, but there was
no one to answer me.)
